text: The Águeda () is a river tributary of the Douro River, that springs from the Serra das Mesas in Spain, in the autonomous community of Castile and León. It flows until it reaches the Douro River near Barca de Alva, Portugal. The Portugal–Spain border follows the Águeda for much of its course. == See also == * List of rivers of Spain ==References== ===Sources=== * Category:Rivers of Spain Agueda Agueda Agueda Category:Portugal–Spain border Category:Tributaries of the Douro River Category:Ramsar sites in Portugal
title: Águeda (river)
